content.en: Enhancing X-ray Analysis: Scientists have been exploring the use of algorithms in X-ray diffraction to generate three-dimensional grain maps and improve the quality of structural analysis in polycrystalline materials. These algorithms, such as the algebraic reconstruction technique and the discrete algebraic reconstruction technique, are being optimized and combined with other data sources, like electron scattering, to determine the characteristics of thousands of grains and resolve intragranular orientation fields. These advancements in algorithmic analysis are enabling faster and more accurate processing of X-ray diffraction data for structural characterization.
content.da: Forbedring af røntgenanalyse: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer i røntgendiffraktion for at generere tredimensionale kornkort og forbedre kvaliteten af strukturanalyse i polykrystallinske materialer. Disse algoritmer, såsom algebraisk rekonstruktionsteknik og diskret algebraisk rekonstruktionsteknik, bliver optimeret og kombineret med andre datakilder, som elektronspredning, for at bestemme egenskaberne af tusindvis af korn og løse intrakornorienteringsfelter. Disse fremskridt inden for algoritmisk analyse muliggør hurtigere og mere nøjagtig behandling af røntgendiffraktionsdata til strukturel karakterisering.
